dublin_core.dcvalue: Litigation after cybersurgery i e remote robotic surgery will be complex In addition to being able to sue physicians and hospitals patients who sustain an adverse outcome after cybersurgery will have the potential to sue the robotic manufacturer and the telecommunications company Moreover cybersurgery litigation will involve laws that are generally unfamiliar to healthcare providers Accordingly this article examines a lawsuit involving a robotic surgical instrument as a model to suggest where liability traps may arise during the delivery of cybersurgery
The international journal of medical robotics + computer assisted surgery : MRCAS
The complexity of litigation associated with robotic surgery and cybersurgery.
